A pandemic occurs when an influenza virus, which is not previously known to be circulating among humans and to which most people do not have immunity, emerges and transmits among humans. These viruses may emerge, circulate, and cause large outbreaks outside of the normal influenza season.
15, 16 The World Health Organization (WHO) was called in 2005 to strengthen the surveillance system of all events of international public health concern.
17 The strengthening of the influenza surveillance system was set as a goal by WHO and concerned bodies in 2009, following the emergence of the novel strain of influenza virus A(H1N1)pdm09.
